main event: A civilian witness observed a slow-moving bright red object in the sky that changed color from blue to green and finally faded to white as it disappeared over the horizon in South Jamesport, New York on May 5, 1966.
interesting points: The object was initially described as looking like a slow-moving star or satellite, about 500 feet in the sky.
The object drifted with a saccadic motion, as if floating, and flew at a 25-degree angle in the north direction before changing direction.
The total observation time was about 20 minutes.
At least 13 people, including the witness and several of his neighbors, reported seeing the light.
An officer from the Suffolk County Air Force Base also believed he saw the light, describing it as a light plane with a white starboard or port landing light.
sighted object: a slow-moving bright red object that changed color to blue, green, and white
witnesses: 1 civilian witness, with additional 12 neighbors and an officer from the nearby air force base
